3 bed detached house for sale

Property details

Listing view statistics

Last 30 days: 21 page views

Since listed: 21 page views

Description

Situated within the popular Hartley Meadow development, on the outskirts of the historic village of Nether Stowey is this immaculately presented detached property which has been tastefully upgraded since its original construction in 2004 and offers superb living accommodation.

Within easy reach of a number of local amenities and the Quantocks, an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, this property offers the ideal balance between modern convenience and country living. Viewing is highly recommended.
At A glance


â¢ Modern Detached Property

â¢ Constructed in 2004 by Westbury Homes (now Charles Church)

â¢ Three Bedrooms (All With Fitted Wardrobes)

â¢ Master Bedroom With En-Suite Shower Room

â¢ Open-Plan Kitchen/Dining Room

â¢ Downstairs Cloakroom & Conservatory

â¢ Low Maintenance Rear Garden

â¢ Driveway & Single Garage

â¢ Popular Development

â¢ Convenient To Many Local Amenities

â¢ EPC rating: Tbc
Accommodation


Constructed by Westbury Homes, now Charles Church, this modern home has greatly benefitted from an upgraded kitchen with induction hob and integrated double oven, the addition of a conservatory and a combi-condensing gas fired boiler. This UPVC double glazed, gas centrally heated accommodation briefly comprises: Entrance hallway, spacious dual aspect lounge, kitchen/dining room, conservatory and downstairs cloakroom. Arranged on the first floor and accessed from a generously size landing is a family bathroom and three bedrooms; all benefit from fitted wardrobes - the master bedroom further benefits from an en-suite shower room. Externally, there is parking on own driveway to the front aspect, garage with side door to garden and a well stocked, landscaped garden with side access.
Location


Located on the Northern outskirts of Nether Stowey. Hartley Meadow offers the ideal balance between modern convenience and country living. The historic village of Nether Stowey has many facilities including a library, restaurant, butchers and three pubs.

The Quantock Hills offer a wide range woodland and moorland walks. Slightly further away, the bustling market town of Bridgwater offers a wider range of amenities and has excellent transport links to the M5 motorway and mainline rail link.
Viewings by appointment only


To arrange a viewing appointment or to discuss this property further please contact Joseph Casson Estate Agency on .

Energy costs explained

Water costs explained

Water consumption is based on average water usage for the predicted occupancy of the property based on the number of bedrooms.
Total annual consumption (in cubic meters) is then averaged into a monthly cost.
Note: If you have 2 separate suppliers for water and sewage, you may receive 2 separate bills.

Council tax

Close dialog
Estimated cost

Â£160 per month

When paid over 10 months

The breakdown

  • Council tax band D Â£160 per month

    Sedgemoor

Council tax explained

The Council Tax cost displayed is based on the council tax band and on the basis of 2 adults living at the property. The monthly cost shown excludes any discounts and is rounded to the nearest pound.
Full information on Council Tax discount entitlements can be found on the Gov.UK's website.
